prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
Firefighters and police were seen outside the office of Mike Freer MP

Police are investigating a suspected arson attack at the office of North London Conservative MP Mike Freer.

A fire broke out at the rear of the North Finchley and Golders Green MP's constituency office at around 19:00 on Christmas Eve.

The Met Police confirmed it is investigating the fire.

Mr Freer told the BBC the fire happened at the rear of the premises and no one was in the building at the time of the incident.

He continued: "The police and fire brigade were on the scene in minutes and have been incredible in their response."

London Fire Brigade (LFB) confirmed the fire started in a shed outside the office before spreading to the rest of the building.

An LFB spokesperson said: "An external shed was destroyed by fire. Part of the first, second and third floors of the property were also damaged by the blaze."

In a statement, a Metropolitan Police spokesperson said: "The cause of the fire is under investigation as it is believed it may have been started deliberately. There have been no arrests."

Pictures posted on social media showed Metropolitan Police and LFB vehicles at the premises on Sunday evening.

Mr Freer has represented the North London constituency since 2010.

He is parliamentary under-secretary of state for courts and legal services, a junior role in the Ministry of Justice.

Pictures show the fire spread to an office inside the building
stories:
Firefighters and law enforcement officers swarmed the scene of an unexpected incident at the office of South London Labour MP Anna Thompson.

An unexplained fire ignited in the early hours of New Year's Day, engulfing the rear of the Streatham and Brixton MP's constituency office.

South Wales Police and the London Fire Brigade confirmed their involvement in the investigation.

Ms. Thompson shared her perspective with the press, expressing gratitude for the quick response of emergency services.

"The fire started at the rear of the premises, and fortunately, no one was present during the incident," she stated. "The police and fire department arrived promptly, and their efforts have been commendable."

London Fire Brigade reported that a small outbuilding adjacent to the office was completely consumed by the flames, which then spread to the interior of the building.

An LFB spokesperson reported: "A detached outbuilding was destroyed by fire. Sections of the ground, first, and second floors of the property sustained damage as a result."

In a statement, a South Wales Police spokesperson stated: "The cause of the fire is currently being investigated. It is believed the fire may have been intentionally set, and there have been no reported arrests."

Images circulating on social media depicted South Wales Police and London Fire Brigade vehicles at the location on New Year's Day morning.

Ms. Thompson has represented the South London constituency since 2015.

She currently serves as the Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Health and Social Care, a junior role in the Department of Health and Social Care.

Despite the setback, images reveal that the interior office space was not entirely destroyed by the blaze.

Firefighters and law enforcement officers rushed to the unexpected scene of a fire at the constituency office of North London Green Party MP, Samir Patel.

The origins of the blaze remain a mystery, as it erupted in the dead of night on February 14th. The fire began at the back of the office, located in Hackney, quickly spreading to an adjacent outbuilding.

North London Fire Brigade and Metropolitan Police confirmed their presence at the scene, working diligently to contain the situation and gather evidence.

Mr. Patel released a statement, expressing his appreciation for the quick response of the emergency services. "The fire started at the rear of the premises, and thankfully, no one was present during the incident," he stated. "The police and fire department arrived promptly, and their efforts have been remarkable."

London Fire Brigade reported that the outbuilding, a small storage shed, had been completely destroyed by the flames. Sections of the ground, first, and second floors of the building sustained significant damage.

In a statement, a Metropolitan Police spokesperson said, "The cause of the fire is currently under investigation. It is believed the fire may have been intentionally set, and no arrests have been made at this time."

Photographs circulating on social media depicted emergency vehicles from both the London Fire Brigade and the Metropolitan Police at the scene on Valentine's Day morning.

Mr. Patel has represented the North London constituency since 2018 and currently serves as the Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Education, a junior role in the Department for Education.

Despite the extensive damage to the office space, images reveal that the interior remained largely intact.

Unforeseen Flames Engulf North London MP's Constituency Office

In the early hours of February 14th, an unanticipated inferno broke out at the constituency office of prominent North London MP, Zara Thompson, located in Haringey.

The fiery episode baffled authorities, as the flames emerged in the stillness of the night. The blaze originated at the rear of the building, swiftly engulfing an adjacent outbuilding.

The North London Fire Brigade and Metropolitan Police swiftly responded to the scene, exerting every effort to contain the situation and collect essential evidence.

Ms. Thompson expressed her gratitude towards the prompt actions of the emergency services in a statement. "The fire ignited at the back of the premises, fortunately, there was no one present during the incident," she stated. "The police and fire department arrived promptly, and their interventions have been extraordinary."

London Fire Brigade disclosed that the outbuilding, a compact storage facility, had been obliterated by the flames. The ground, first, and second floors of the building endured considerable damage.

A Metropolitan Police spokesperson commented on the ongoing investigation, stating, "The origins of the fire are under investigation. It is speculated that the fire may have been intentionally set, and no arrests have been made at this time."

Social media circulated photographs of emergency vehicles from both the London Fire Brigade and the Metropolitan Police at the scene on Valentine's Day morning.

Ms. Thompson has been the North London representative since 2020 and currently holds the position of Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Health, a junior role in the Department of Health.

Despite the severe damage to the office space, images revealed that the interior largely remained undamaged.

Unforeseen Flames Strike Heart of South Manchester: MP's Constituency Office in Flames

In the stillness of the night on February 15th, an unexpected inferno erupted at the constituency office of prominent South Manchester MP, Raj Patel, situated in Didsbury.
